result.execSummary:
The defendant Paul J. Schleis was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Paul J. Schleis is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Paul J. Schleis was found guilty of Criminal Damage to Property, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

11:00 AM DA calls cases 15CF45, 15CF46, 15CF56, 16CF46, 18CF84 and states appearances. Defendant Paul J. Schleis appeared in custody with attorney Jessica Fehrenbach.  Mark T. Fuhr appeared for the State of Wisconsin. DA states on 18CF84 recommendations and motions court to amend charge to Misd Battery 940.19(1). Court questions parties on 18CF84 if plea and sentencing will be completed today. Both parties give comments. Parties acknowledge receipt of revocation packet and waive its reading. On 18CF84 DE enters plea of GUILTY to amended count 1. Court grants motion by the State to amend Ct. 1 on 18CF84.  DA certifies Victim Rights Compliance.  Court questions DE regarding the plea.  DA explains elements of charge.  Court finds plea/waiver to be free, etc.  Court finds factual basis does exist.  Court accepts plea, finds DE guilty and orders entry of JOC amended Ct.1 on 18CF84. Parties acknowledge receipt of revocation packet and waive its reading. On cases 15CF45, 15CF46, 15CF56, 16CF46, Recommendations and comments by DA.  Comments by Atty Fehrenbach. Comments by DE. Summation by Court.

records.addlTxt: and Order

1:15 pm - DA calls cases 15CF45, 15CF46, 15CF47, 15CF51, 15CF56, 15CF57, 16CF42, 16CF43 and 16CF46, states appearances and agreement reached.  Defendant Paul J. Schleis in court with attorney Andrew M. Morgan.  Defendant in custody.  Mark T. Fuhr appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  The DA moves to amend 15CF56 from Felony to Misd. bail jumping.  So ordered.  DE enters plea of NO CONTEST to Ct 2 on 15CF45, Ct 3 on 15CF46, and amended 15CF56.   Court questions DE regarding the plea and plea questionnaire form.  DA explains elements of charge.  Court finds plea/waiver to be free, etc.  Court finds factual basis does exist.  Court accepts plea, finds DE guilty and orders entry of JOC on Ct 2 on 15CF45, Ct 3 on 15CF46, and amended 15CF56.  DE admits to 15CF47, 16CF42, 16CF43, along with uncharged PPD 15-895, and PRSO16-1240 for purposes of restitution and service fees.  DA certifies victims rights compliance. DE to submit DNA sample at PRSO. On motion of state, court dismisses Ct 1 on 15CF45, Cts 1 &2 on 15CF46, 15CF51, both counts in 15CF57.

Court imposes:
15CF45 Ct 2 - Sentence withheld - 3 years probation
Conditions of probation
$300 fine, $250 DNAAS, 6 months jail with huber (cs) with 1 day credit for time served, psycho-sexual assessment, followthrough and treatment, apology to victim in a way and manner to be determined by probation officer, AODA and followthrough with any recommendation.  Separately from probation, Sex offender registry is ordered DE's lifetime.

15CF46 Ct 3 - Sentence withheld - 2 years probation
Conditions of probation
$243 court costs, $200 DNAAS, $25 restitution + $2.50 surcharge for a total of $27.50, 30 days jail with huber (cs), with credit for 1 day served.  AODA and followthrough with any recommendation

Amended 15CF56 - Sentence withheld - 2 years probation
Conditions of probation
$300 fine, $200 DNAAS, $65 SBDA, 30 days jail with huber (cs), AODA and followthrough with any recommendation, apology to victim in a way and manner to be determined by probation officer, along with costs on Dismissed but read in costs on 15CF47 - $45 SBDA, 16CF42 - $65 SBDA, 16CF43 $115.50 blood draw fee to PPD.

Appeal rights given.
Plea/sentencing hearing on September 28, 2016 at 01:15 pm.
